verse.roman:
yeṣu yeṣu ca bhūteṣu
bhaktyā tvāṁ paramarṣayaḥ
upāsīnāḥ prapadyante
saṁsiddhiṁ tad vadasva me

synonyms: yeṣu yeṣu—in which various; ca—also; bhūteṣu—forms; bhaktyā—with devotion; tvām—You; parama-ṛṣayaḥ—the great sages; upāsīnāḥ—worshiping; prapadyante—achieve; saṁsiddhim—perfection; tat—that; vadasva—please speak; me—to me.
translation: Please tell me of the perfections that great sages achieve by worshiping You with devotion. Also, kindly explain which of Your different forms they worship.

purport.text: Śrī Uddhava here inquires about the spiritual opulences of the Lord, which consist primarily of His viṣṇu-tattva expansions such as Vāsudeva, Saṅkarṣaṇa, Pradyumna and Aniruddha. By worshiping different plenary expansions of the Lord one achieves particular perfections, and Śrī Uddhava wants to know about this.
